greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest prime factor of the n-th hexagonal number (A000384).
comment: As A000384(n+1) = (n*2+1)*(n*1+1), A000384(n) belongs to A180045 for n > 3, and a(n) tends to infinity as n tends to infinity. - _Rémy Sigrist_, Feb 23 2020
link: Colin Barker, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1000
mathematica: FactorInteger[#][[-1,1]]&/@PolygonalNumber[6,Range[2,70]] (* Requires Mathematica version 10 or later *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 10 2018 *)
results.author: _Colin Barker_, Jul 20 2015
